actions.text: Today's skill is about Managing Stress 💚 Take a Pause whenever you are feeling angry, overwhelmed, stressed or worried.
This can help when you are upset with your teen or when they have done something wrong. 😣 Staying calm makes you feel better, and lets you build positive relationships and take care of others🌱
Here is a comic to remind you of Taking a Pause!
“How am I going to get through this?”
“Whatever it is, I am OK.”
“Breathe in. Breathe out."
“I can do this. We will get through it together.”

✅⬜️⬜️

You’ve completed 33% of this skill! Press NEXT to continue.
Here is a video to help you through Taking a Pause!
Here's an audio message to help you through Taking a Pause! 🌷
Does this skill sound helpful? Let’s practise Taking a Pause together!

1️⃣ **SIT DOWN**
⏸ Find somewhere to sit.

⭐ You can close your eyes if you’d like.

2️⃣ **LISTEN**
🌱 Take a deep breath.
👂 Listen to the air flowing in and out.
🔄 Repeat this 5 times.

3️⃣ **NOTICE**
✨ Notice how your body feels while you breathe.
🔵 Notice if you feel calmer.

4️⃣ **OPEN YOUR EYES**

👀 When you are ready, open your eyes.

🔑 Now you can handle stressful moments more calmly.

✅✅⬜️

You’ve completed 66% of this skill! Press NEXT to continue.

Try Taking a Pause whenever you feel stressed. ⏰ It gives you a chance calm down. A few deep breaths or connecting with the ground beneath you can make a difference. You can also Take a Pause with your teen!
Well done! You have learnt how to Take a Pause and have earned yourself a badge!
You have completed this skill. ⭐ Well done for taking this step to learn new parenting skills!
Today's skill is about spending time with Your Teen 😃
Spending time with Your Teen will help you form a happy relationship. 💙

Parent: “How are you doing, Andy?”

Teen (looking sad): “I wish I could hang out with my friends.”
Parent (thinking): "Hmmm…that can wait…"

Parent (looks back to teen): “I understand it is hard to be separate from your friends. Especially since I am sure they are missing you, too. Let’s think of some ways that you could reach out to them.”

Teen: "Maybe I can make a TikTok video to share with them. But I am not sure how…can you help me?”

Parent: “I would be happy to help and would like to know more about TikTok, too!”

✅⬜️⬜️

You’ve completed 33% of this skill! Press NEXT to continue.
Here’s a video on spending time with your teen.
Here’s a audio message on spending time with your teen.
Here are three tips to remember to help you make the most of spending time with your teen: DAY, PLAY, and STAY.

1️⃣ **“DAY’’- Try to do it every day**
⏰ Spend 5 minutes (or more!) with your teen each day.

2️⃣ **‘’PLAY’’ - Let them choose the activity**
⏰ Ask to spend time with your Teen.
⚽ Let them choose what to do or talk about.
🎈Try different activities together.
😃 Have fun.

3️⃣ **‘’STAY’' - Focus on your teen**
📺 Switch off the TV and put aside phones.
👀 Look at your teen. Nod or say “I see” to show you are really paying attention. 
💛 Do not judge your teen. 
👂 Rephrase back what your teen says. It shows you are really listening to them.

✅✅⬜️

You’ve completed 66% of this skill! Press NEXT to continue.
Home task! ⭐ This week, try to spend at least 5 minutes of time with Your Teen every day. It will make such a difference! Do you have time to do it today? ⏰
Great! Use the tips you have learnt today and have fun! Spending time with your teen is a great way to form a positive relationship with them. 💙
That's OK! If you don't have time today, set some time aside tomorrow. You and your teen will gain a lot from this. 💙

Nice, you get a badge for completing the One on One Time skill! 🌈 You have now completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Improve my relationship with my Teen. Well done, this is great progress! 👑
Well done for committing to help your teen live a good life. It shows you really care! 💙
Today’s skill is about Praise. 🎉 How did the message above make you feel? We all feel better when others notice the good things we do. It’s even better when it is by someone we love!
Praise your teen when they are behaving well! ⭐ This creates a positive and loving relationship with them.
Here is a comic which uses all steps on praising your teen.
Parent: “Thank you for being quiet while I talked to my boss. I appreciate it! Here, you can use my phone to WhatsApp your friends”
Teen: “Thanks! I really want to see how they are doing.”

✅⬜️⬜️

You’ve completed 33% of this skill! Press NEXT to continue.
Here's a video on the importance of praise. When you focus on positive behaviour, your teen is likely to do it more often and feel good about themselves! 🌈
Here's an audio message on how you can focus on positive behaviour by praising your teen! 👂

When you focus on positive behaviour, your teen is likely to do it more often and feel good about themselves!

Here are 4 simple tips for praising your teen:

1️⃣ **SEE IT**

👀 Look for anything good or helpful your teen does.

⏸ Take a moment to notice that they are doing it.

2️⃣ **SAY IT**

🏆 Praise them when you see them do it.

✅ Tell them specifically what they have done well.

🎉 Be enthusiastic and really mean it!

🔄 This means they are more likely to do it again.

3️⃣ **REPEAT IT**

🌷 Look for something to praise your teen for every day.

🔶 Even if it is something really small, keep doing it.

4️⃣ **KEEP IT POSITIVE**

💡 Make sure you focus on something your teen has done well.

🌈 Keeping it positive reminds your teen that you notice them and care.

✅✅⬜️

You’ve completed 66% of this skill! Press NEXT to continue.
Do you feel confident using what you’ve learnt about praise with your own family?
Amazing! 🎉 We love to see it! Look for three things that you can praise your teen for every day. You can praise other adults in your household, too. 💛 Notice how they respond!

That's OK! Sometimes things take time! 💙 You can review this skill in the Main Menu any time. At the end of the day, think of all of the positive things that happened - this makes it easier to point them out. ☀️ With time, praise will come easily to you.
Sorry, I don't understand what you mean.

Well done, you have gained another badge! ⭐ You have now learnt the four steps to Praise. You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1)  out of @fields.c_n_mod skills in the goal “Improve my relationship with my teen.”

Today’s skill is about helping our teens with stress. 
Can you remember something you stressed about as a teen? 😣 A break-up, stress in your home, being bullied, exams? 📝

If you could give a message to your teenage self, what would you say? ▶️

Teens’ brains are still growing. They don’t always have good skills for dealing with stress. 🔴

Some teens feel a lot of stress.❗In response, they might feel anxious, withdraw themselves from others, or even feel sick! Some teens may respond with violence, self-harm, having suicidal thoughts, or by using drugs or alcohol to cope. 😔

You can help your teen cope with their stress by supporting them through it. 💙
Quiz!
Which of the following is NOT a symptom of stress?
That’s wrong [...]
That’s wrong [...]
That’s wrong [...]
That’s right. Teens who are stressed experience many symptoms

I’m trying my best.
Trying to make ends meet and raise three children alone is very difficult.

Other parents find this hard; too. I’m not alone.
— This is not the last test that my child will take. There will be other
opportunities to help her/him.

Things have been very difficult lately, and I need to take some time out
to look after myself.

✅✅⬜️⬜️

You’ve completed 50% of this skill! Press NEXT to continue.
Here’s a video to give you some tips on how to support your teen when they are feeling stressed. 💛
Here’s an audio message to give you some tips on how to support your teen when they are feeling stressed. 💛
Here are some tips to help you support your teen when they are feeling stressed:

1️⃣ **NOTICE**
👀 Look for signs that your teen is feeling stressed. 
🚩 They might get angry a lot, want to be alone all the time, be unable to focus, feel tired often, or not feel like doing any work.

2️⃣ **TALK**
❓ Talk to your teen about what makes them stressed. 
😣 They might feel a lot of stress about something that feels small to us. To them, it might feel huge!
💛 Let them tell you about what gives them stress without judging them.

3️⃣ **BE THERE**
👂 Listen to what they say, even if you can’t do anything about it.
💚 Tell them it is okay to feel stressed
💡 Help them decide which things are more important to worry about.
🔑 Help them take steps to change what is causing their stress where they can.
📖 Help them prepare for what they are stressing about.

✅✅✅⬜️

You’ve completed 75% of this skill! Press NEXT to continue.

Home Activity! With your teen, make a list of some things they stress about often, and what they could do when they need to cope with them. Talk about how you can help when they are stressed, too. You can come back to this list next time you notice your teen might feel stressed. 

Can you make a list about coping with stress with your teen sometime this week?

Great! This is such a good way to help our teens cope with their stress. 💚 Supporting your teen when they are stressed helps them deal with it better, and will help them feel more safe and secure. Well done, keep at it! 🏆

That’s OK. It can be hard to talk about these things! Next time your teen is acting outside of what you expect from them, think about if it might be because of stress. 🚩 You can use the Main Menu to come back to this skill for tips to support them. 💚
